THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE IN BEARWALLOW PARK, WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE GLENWOOD RANGER DISTRICT OF THE GILA NATIONAL FOREST IN SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO. THERE ARE TWO EXISTING MEADOWS WITHIN BEARWALLOW PARK THAT CONSIST OF MIXED CONIFER, ASPEN, MOUNTAIN RUSH, WATER SEDGE AND COMMON SPIKERUSH. WILDLIFE SPECIES SUCH AS ELK, MERRIAM'S TURKEY AND THE MEXICAN SPOTTED OWL OCCUR WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA. LIVESTOCK IN THE AREA TO ENTER THE MEADOWS RESULTING IN DEGRADED HABITAT. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND FISH AND THE FOREST SERVICE TO COLLABORATE AND CONSTRUCT PIPE FENCE EXCLOSURES AROUND EACH MEADOW. BY BUILDING A MORE DURABLE PIPE FENCE THERE WILL BE LESS MAINTENANCE COSTS OVER THE YEARS AND IT WILL MORE EFFECTIVELY EXCLUDE LIVESTOCK, AND THUS ALLOWING THE MEADOW HABITAT TO IMPROVE. THE PIPE FENCES WILL PROTECT 5.5 ACRES OF IMPORTANT WILDLIFE HABITAT FROM FUTURE DEGRADATIONS.

THIS GRANT PROPOSAL INCLUDES FOUR SEPARATE PROJECTS, EACH INTER-RELATED TO THE OTHER AND OFTEN SERVING THE SAME CUSTOMERS, BUT EACH WITH A DIFFERENT AND SPECIFIC PURPOSE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THIS WORK IS THE PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC, WHO ARE INTERESTED IN WILDLIFE, HUNTING, AND RECREATIONAL SHOOTING.THE PENNSYLVANIA GAME COMMISSION EXISTS TO MANAGE AND PROTECT WILDLIFE AND THEIR HABITATS WHILE PROMOTING HUNTING AND TRAPPING FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. FOCUS GROUP RESULTS INDICATE THAT CURRENT AND FORMER HUNTERS, CUSTOMERS OF THE GAME COMMISSION, WOULD LIKE THE AGENCY TO REACH OUT TO THEM WITH INFORMATION AND OPPORTUNITIES ABOUT HUNTING. APPROXIMATELY 70 PERCENT OF AMERICANS HAVE SOME FORM OF SOCIAL MEDIA, WHICH MAKES SOCIAL MEDIA A POWERFUL INFORMATION SHARING TOOL FOR OUR AGENCY. SOCIAL MEDIA ALSO PROVIDES OUR AGENCY THE ABILITY TO INTERACT DIRECTLY WITH THE PUBLIC, ALLOWING US TO BUILD CREDIBILITY AND TRUST. WITH OVER 300,000 FOLLOWERS BETWEEN OUR AGENCY'S TWITTER, FACEBOOK, AND INSTAGRAM ACCOUNTS, AND WITH SOME POSTS REACHING MILLIONS OF PEOPLE, OUR AGENCY HAS AN OPPORTUNITY TO NOT ONLY PROMOTE HUNTING AND TRAPPING WITHIN OUR STATE, BUT TO RECRUIT, RETAIN, AND REACTIVATE HUNTERS AND TRAPPERS NATIONWIDE. THE EXPECTED RESULTS AND BENEFIT OF THIS PROJECT ARE:- INCREASED SUPPORT FOR PGC WSFR-FUNDED WILDLIFE CONSERVATION EFFORTS, FOR GAME AND NONGAME SPECIES, ACROSS THE STATE.- INCREASED PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING, TRAPPING AND SHOOTING PROGRAMS PROVIDED BY THE PENNSYLVANIA GAME COMMISSION.PROJECT 1: THE PURPOSE OF PGC'S SOCIAL MEDIA EFFORTS IS TO ESTABLISH OUR AGENCY AS THE GO-TO RESOURCE FOR INFORMATION ABOUT HUNTING AND TRAPPING IN THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA. WE PLAN TO UTILIZE THE AGENCY'S SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS TO INCREASE AWARENESS, SUPPORT FOR, AND PARTICIPATION IN HUNTING AND TRAPPING.PROJECT 2: THE PURPOSE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA GAME COMMISSION'S MARKETING AND OUTREACH PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE HUNTER/SHOOTER RECRUITMENT, RETENTION AND REACTIVATION EFFORTS WHILE PROVIDING FORMAL PROGRAMS, PRODUCTS AND SERVICES WHICH SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE INCREASED HUNTING/SHOOTING PARTICIPATION IN PENNSYLVANIA.PROJECT 3: THE PURPOSE OF PGC'S DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS PROJECT IS DRIVEN FROM CONTENT COLLECTION AND CREATION EFFORTS. THIS ALLOWS THE AGENCY TO ESTABLISH A VISUAL LIBRARY OF HIGH-QUALITY PHOTOS AND VIDEOS TO PROMOTE HUNTING, TRAPPING, AND SHOOTING OPPORTUNITIES IN PENNSYLVANIA.PROJECT 4: THE PURPOSE OF THE PENNSYLVANIA GAME COMMISSION'S SHOOTING SPORTS OUTREACH PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE AND/OR PARTNER WITH FORMAL PROGRAMS, PRODUCTS AND SERVICES WHICH SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE SHOOTING SPORTS PARTICIPATION AND SKILLS DEVELOPMENT IN PENNSYLVANIA, ENGAGE AND RECRUIT NEW RECREATIONAL SPORTS SHOOTERS, AND CREATE NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATIONAL SHOOTING.

COLORADO DIVISION OF PARKS AND WILDLIFE (CPW) WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW SHOP BUILDING AT ANDRICK PONDS STATE WILDLIFE AREA IN NE COLORADO. THERE IS CURRENTLY NO STORAGE FACILITY AT ANDRICK PONDS SWA TO STORE EQUIPMENT OR MATERIALS. CURRENTLY, EQUIPMENT IS STORED AT THE HILLROSE SWA SHOP, WHICH IS 45 MILES EAST OF ANDRICK. THAT MEANS ANYTIME EQUIPMENT IS NEEDED FOR PROJECTS AT ANDRICK, MOBILIZING IT IS AN EXHAUSTIVE, TIME CONSUMING PROCESS. THIS ONSITE BUILDING WILL REDUCE COSTS AND TIME IN LOADING, HAULING, MILEAGE, TOOLS, IMPLEMENT COSTS, AND COSTS OF MAINTAINING BOTH PROPERTIES.

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR WILDLIFE CONSERVATION IN PUERTO RICO PROJECT IS THE HELP PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES (PRDNER) PROVIDE LANDOWNERS TO MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AND ADDRESS CONCERNS IN ORDER TO PROTECT AND ENHANCE WILDLIFE HABITATS ON THEIR PROPERTIES. THE PROJECT STAFF ALSO, HELP LAND USERS (PUBLIC, PRIVATE OR INSTITUTIONS LAND) THAT YET LACK THE SCIENTIFIC EXPERTISE FOR DEVELOPING HABITAT MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. MOREOVER, PROJECT STAFF PROVIDE SUPPORT TO ACTIVITIES SUCH AS HUNTING, BIRD WATCHING, ALSO HUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND, AMONG OTHERS. PROJECT STAFF COLLABORATES WITH AND PROVIDES TECHNICAL GUIDANCE TO PROJECTS CONDUCTED BY THE (PRDNER) AND OTHER AGENCIES WANTING TO ESTABLISH AND IMPLEMENT PRIORITIES FOR THE CONSERVATION OF WILDLIFE RESOURCES AND THEIR HABITAT.

SINCE THE ENACTMENT OF THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT IN 1969, STATE GAME AND FISH AGENCIES ACROSS THE NATION ARE LEGALLY REQUIRED TO CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS ON DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS THAT HAVE A FEDERAL NEXUS (I.E. A PROJECT THAT IS FUNDED WITH FEDERAL MONEY OR OCCURS ON FEDERAL LAND). THE REVIEWS ARE REQUIRED IN ORDER TO RECEIVE A PERMIT FROM A REGULATORY AGENCY OR FUNDING FOR POSSIBLE CONSTRUCTION. THE NORTH DAKOTA GAME AND FISH DEPARTMENT'S COORDINATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS CARRIED OUT BY A SMALL WORK UNIT (I.E. CONSERVATION SECTION) WITHIN THE AGENCY THAT CONDUCTS THE MAJORITY OF THE WORK ASSOCIATED WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW. THE CONSERVATION SECTION HAS 3 FULL TIME STAFF BIOLOGISTS WHO CARRY OUT THE DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROGRAM. EACH YEAR, THE CONSERVATION SECTION RECEIVES ROUGHLY 500-600 PROJECTS OR SOLICITATIONS OF THIS NATURE. BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY PROJECT PROPONENTS, STAFF CONDUCT A ?DESK TOP LEVEL' REVIEW OF THE PROPOSED PROJECTS FOR POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO FISH AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY OF WHERE THE PROJECT. IF ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IS REQUIRED, STAFF MAY INTERACT WITH THE PROJECT PROPONENTS OR STATE, FEDERAL AND LOCAL RESOURCE EXPERTS. REVIEWS FOR THE VAST MAJORITY OF PROJECTS ARE CONDUCTED WITHIN 2-4 WEEKS OF RECEIVING A SOLICITATION, WITH MOST PROJECTS HAVING MINIMAL IMPACTS. THE PROJECT PROPONENTS ARE ROUTINELY PROVIDED A BRIEF SYNOPSIS OF THE PROJECTS MINIMAL IMPACT DETERMINATION VIA FORMAL LETTER, EMAIL OR FAX. IN INSTANCES WHERE IT IS DETERMINED THAT A PROJECT WILL IMPART LARGER OR MORE SUBSTANTIAL IMPACTS, STAFF WILL WORK WITH PROJECT PROPONENTS TO LESSEN OR MINIMIZE AFFECTS BY SUGGESTING ALTERNATIVE CONSTRUCTION MEASURES, TECHNIQUES, TIME FRAMES OR OFFSETS. THIS MAY REQUIRE ON-SITE VISITS, IN PERSON MEETINGS, PHONE CALLS OR MEETINGS WITH OTHER NATURAL RESOURCE AGENCIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PAY THE 2021 SOUTH DAKOTA PROPERTY TAXES FOR THE GAME PRODUCTION AREAS OWNED AND OR MANAGED BY THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF GAME, FISH AND PARKS WHICH PROVIDE IMPORTANT WILDLIFE HABITAT AND PUBLIC WATER ACCESS THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THE GRANT WILL PAY THE ASSESSED PROPERTY TAXES ON THE 269,940.10 ACRES OF GAME PRODUCTION AREAS OWNED IN FEE TITLE IN 59 COUNTIES. PAYMENT OF REAL PROPERTY TAXES WILL ALLOW THE DEPARTMENT TO MAINTAIN OWNERSHIP OF THESE IMPORTANT AREAS FOR THE BENEFIT OF MANAGING WILDLIFE AND WILDLIFE HABITATS AND PROVIDE PUBLIC USE AND ACCESS TO WILDLIFE RESOURCES.

THE WALK-IN AREA PROGRAM (WIA) PROVIDES UNLIMITED FREE PUBLIC ACCESS TO PRIVATE LAND FOR HUNTING RECREATION. THIS PROGRAM HAS INCREASED HUNTING OPPORTUNITY AND IMPROVED HUNTING QUALITY. IT HAS ALSO PROVIDED AN OPPORTUNITY FOR IMPROVED RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN LANDOWNERS AND SPORTSMEN BY ALLOWING THE HARVEST OF WILDLIFE BEFORE THEIR NUMBERS EXCEED LANDOWNER TOLERANCE.

THE FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND MONITORING ON THE HEALTH, ABUNDANCE, DISTRIBUTION , AND HARVEST OF WILDLIFE IN CONNECTICUT. DATA IS COLLECTED ON TURKEY, SMALL GAME, WHITE-TAILED DEER, FUR-BEARERS, AND MIGRATORY BIRDS TO SUPPORT ECOLOGICALLY SOUND, SCIENCE-BASED CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. MAINTAINING HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE POPULATIONS OF WILDLIFE WITHIN BIOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL LIMITS SUPPORTS THE BUREAU OF NATURAL RESOURCES MISSION OF CONSERVATION, AND THE PUBLIC USE AND APPRECIATION OF THESE NATURAL RESOURCES.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO OBLIGATE STATE FISCAL YEAR 2023 FUNDS FOR ADMINISTRATION, PUBLICATIONS, AND THREE (3) ACTIVE RESEARCH STUDIES.

THE NORTHEASTERN UNITED STATES HOSTS A DIVERSE COMMUNITY OF TERRESTRIAL FURBEARER SPECIES. THESE SPECIES ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF A FUNCTIONING ECOSYSTEM AND PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND ECONOMIC VALUE TO MULTIPLE STAKEHOLDERS. ECOLOGICALLY, FURBEARERS CONTRIBUTE DIRECTLY TO PROCESSES SUCH AS PREY POPULATION REGULATION AND SEED DISPERSAL, WHICH IN TURN INFLUENCE FLORAL AND FAUNAL BIODIVERSITY, ECOSYSTEM STABILITY, AND COMMUNITY-LEVEL DYNAMICS SUCH AS DISEASE TRANSMISSION. BEYOND THESE ECOLOGICAL ROLES, FURBEARERS ARE VALUED BY STAKEHOLDERS FOR A VARIETY OF REASONS, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO WILDLIFE VIEWING AND HARVEST. GIVEN THIS ECOLOGICAL AND SOCIAL IMPORTANCE, EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF THESE SPECIES IS PARAMOUNT. AT A FUNDAMENTAL LEVEL, SUCH MANAGEMENT REQUIRES ACCURATE INFORMATION ON SPECIES DISTRIBUTION AND ABUNDANCE ACROSS SPACE AND OVER TIME. HOWEVER, ACQUIRING SUCH INFORMATION FOR FURBEARERS IS CHALLENGING BECAUSE THEY ARE SECRETIVE, CRYPTIC, HIGHLY MOBILE, AND OFTEN PERSIST AT LOW DENSITIES. THIS STUDY WILL DEVELOP AND EVALUATE MONITORING METHODS FOR FURBEARER SPECIES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE. IN TURN, THESE EFFECTIVE MONITORING PROTOCOLS WILL POTENTIALLY INFORM THE MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION OF THESE SPECIES. IN ADDITION, THIS STUDY WILL EVALUATE THE HABITAT RELATIONSHIPS OF WILDLIFE SPECIES TO ADVANCE ECOLOGICAL UNDERSTANDING AND IMPROVE PREDICTIVE ACCURACY OF SPECIES DISTRIBUTION MODELS AND ABUNDANCE ESTIMATES.
IL - FEDERAL ASSISTANCE ADMINISTRATION AND COORDINATION, FW-05-C-65

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT A RESEARCH PROJECT ON KANSAS' MOURNING DOVE POPULATION TO IMPROVE OF UNDERSTANDING OF THE SPECIES THAT WILL ASSIST IN MANAGING THE RESOURCE AT A STATE, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL LEVEL. MOURNING DOVES ARE ONE OF THE MOST HARVESTED SPECIES IN KANSAS AND IMPROVING INFORMATION NECESSARY FOR THEIR MANAGEMENT WILL BENEFIT NOT ONLY THE SPECIES, BUT ALSO THE LARGE NUMBER OF HUNTERS THAT TARGET THEM IN KANSAS AND ELSEWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES, AND THE NON-CONSUMPTIVE USERS THAT ENJOY SEEING AND HEARING THE SPECIES ON THE LANDSCAPE. IN ASSOCIATION WITH OUR SUBRECIPIENT, RESEARCHERS WITH THE COOPERATIVE RESEARCH UNIT AT KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY, WE WILL BE CATCHING AND MARKING MOURNING DOVES WITH TRANSMITTERS THAT WILL ALLOW US TO TRACK AND MONITOR THEIR LOCATION AND MOVEMENT. RESEARCHERS WILL COLLECT INFORMATION ON NESTING, HABITAT USE, REPRODUCTION, AND SURVIVAL. THIS INFORMATION WILL FEED DIRECTLY INTO UPDATING MODELS USED TO ESTIMATE DOVE POPULATION ESTIMATES, AND WILL HELP WITH MORE LOCAL HARVEST MANAGEMENT DECISIONS LIKE INTENSIVELY MANAGED DOVE FIELD LOCATIONS. PROJECT DELIVERABLES WILL BE IN THE FORM OF TECHNICAL AND NON-TECHNICAL PUBLICATIONS SUMMARIZING THIS INFORMATION.

THIS PROJECT PROPOSAL SEEKS FUNDING TO CONTINUE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES OF HUNTERS' FACILITIES ON MONA ISLAND. IN ADDITION, THIS STUDY WILL CONTINUE OBTAINING DATA ON GOAT/PIG HUNTING, CRIPPLING LOSSES, HUNTERS' EFFORT AND SUCCESS. THIS DATA WILL LAY FOUNDATIONS TO ESTABLISH THE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES OF THESE SPECIES. THIS INFORMATION WILL ENABLE THE PRDNER TO PROVIDE HUNTING OPPORTUNITIES TO PUERTO RICO'S BIG-GAME HUNTERS. LASTLY, A RESEARCH PROJECT THROUGH CONTRACTED SERVICES TO EVALUATE THE SPREAD OF INVASIVE GRASS AND TO ASSESS THE STATUS OF INVADED POPULATIONS OF NATIVE PLANT SPECIES ON MONA ISLAND WILL BE UNDERTAKEN. THE RESULTS FROM THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE RESTORATION AND CONSERVATION OF NATIVE HABITATS AND WILDLIFE ON MONA ISLAND.

MOOSE ARE AN ICONIC WILDLIFE SPECIES OF NEW HAMPSHIRE. IN ADDITION TO THEIR ROLE AS PART OF A FUNCTIONING ECOSYSTEM, THEY HAVE SUBSTANTIAL SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND ECONOMIC VALUE. THE OPPORTUNITY TO VIEW OR HUNT MOOSE IS SOUGHT AFTER BY MANY AND BOTH OF THESE ACTIVITIES GENERATE SUBSTANTIAL REVENUE FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES. HOWEVER, NEW HAMPSHIRE'S MOOSE POPULATION HAS DECLINED 50% SINCE 2000, PRIMARILY DUE TO CLIMATE-ENHANCED PARASITISM FROM WINTER TICKS. ACCURATE MOOSE ABUNDANCE DATA IS ESSENTIAL FOR MANAGING THIS POPULATION AND THE CURRENT METHOD, MOOSE SIGHTING RATE BY DEER HUNTERS (DEER HUNTER SURVEY), NEEDS TO BE UPDATED. THIS MONITORING TECHNIQUE WAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED STARTING IN 1998 WITH AN UNDERSTANDING THAT IT WOULD BE RE-CALIBRATED PERIODICALLY TO ACCOUNT FOR CHANGES IN MOOSE DENSITY AND HUNTER BEHAVIOR. GIVEN OVER 20 YEARS HAVE LAPSED SINCE CALIBRATION AND WIDESPREAD PUBLIC CONCERN OVER THE STATUS OF THE DECLINING MOOSE POPULATION, IT IS NOW TIME TO INVESTIGATE THE ACCURACY OF THIS SURVEY AND OTHER MOOSE MONITORING TECHNIQUES. TO INVESTIGATE SURVEY ACCURACY, IT IS BEST TO HAVE A "TRUTH" DATA LAYER THAT CLOSELY MEASURES MOOSE DENSITY AT A FINE SCALE. THE BEST APPROACH FOR DOING THIS IN NEW HAMPSHIRE IS WITH AERIAL INFRARED SURVEYS FROM A PLANE, HOWEVER CONTRACTORS THAT CONDUCT THIS WORK ARE SCARCE AND COST IS HIGH.THIS STUDY WILL DEVELOP AND EVALUATE NOVEL METHODS FOR MONITORING MOOSE ABUNDANCE THAT WILL ALSO SERVE TO RE-CALIBRATE THE DEER HUNTER SURVEY. SPECIFICALLY, THIS WILL INVOLVE TESTING THE EFFICACY OF CAMERA TRAP NETWORKS AND UNPILOTED AERIAL SYSTEMS (I.E. DRONES) EQUIPPED WITH INFRARED SENSORS TO ACCURATELY MEASURE MOOSE DENSITY AT THE WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT UNIT SCALE; THE UNPILOTED AERIAL SYSTEMS SURVEYS MAY SERVE AS "TRUTH" DATA. MOOSE DENSITIES FROM CAMERAS AND UAS SURVEYS WILL BE COMPARED TO DENSITIES GENERATED FROM THE DEER HUNTER SURVEY TO INFORM NEW HAMPSHIRE FISH & GAME DEPARTMENT SELECTION OF LONG-TERM MOOSE MONITORING METHODS. THIS PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED THROUGH A COOPERATIVE PROJECT AGREEMENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE AS A SUBRECIPIENT OF FEDERAL FUNDS. THE INFORMATION WILL BE USED BY THE NEW HAMPSHIRE FISH AND GAME DEPARTMENT TO DETERMINE THE MOST SUITABLE METHOD FOR MONITORING MOOSE POPULATIONS LONG TERM.

THE NEBRASKA OUTDOOR EDUCATION CENTER SEES OVER 15,000 VISITORS ANNUALLY, WITH SEVERAL THOUSAND UTILIZING THE FACILITIES ARCHERY RANGES. THE OUTDOOR RANGE IS THE LARGEST IN THE CAPITAL CITY COMPLETE WITH SHOOTING LANES AND OVERHEAD CANOPY. THE RANGE LACKS A SAFE AND EFFECTIVE ELEVATED SHOOTING PLATFORM FOR ARCHERS TO PRACTICE FOR BOWHUNTING FROM A TREE STAND WHICH IS THE MOST COMMON METHOD OF BOWHUNTING IN NEBRASKA. THE NEW SHOOTING TOWER WILL ALLOW ARCHERS TO SAFELY PRACTICE. THIS ARCHERY TOWER WILL EXPAND PRACTICE FOR BOWHUNTERS SHOOTING FROM ELEVATED STANDS IN THE LINCOLN AREA COMMUNITY THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ONE ELEVATED ARCHERY SHOOTING TOWER AT THE NEBRASKA OUTDOOR EDUCATION CENTER AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE.

THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PURCHASE ~1,568.08 ACRES ALONG THE HUMBOLDT RIVER NORTHEAST OF BATTLE MOUNTAIN, LANDER COUNTY, NV ALONG WITH ~895.41 ACRE-FEET OF WATER RIGHTS . THE PROPERTY IS MAINLY AGRICULTURAL LAND USED FOR CATTLE GRAZING AND CONTAINS WET-MEADOW HABITAT THAT SUPPORTS NUMEROUS SPECIES OF MIGRATORY BIRDS ALONG WITH MULE DEER, WILD TURKEYS, CALIFORNIA QUAIL AND PRONGHORN ANTELOPE. IN ADDITION TO THE WILDLIFE VALUES, THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM OPPORTUNITIES FOR HUNTING, FISHING, TRAPPING, CAMPING, NATURE STUDY AND WILDLIFE VIEWING ON THE AREA. THE PURCHASE OF ADDITIONAL PROPERTY IS VITAL TO NDOW'S MISSION OF MANAGING, PROTECTING AND RESTORING HABITAT IN THE STATE AND UPON TRANSFER OF TITLE WILL BE ADDED TO NDOW'S WMA SYSTEM.

TO FUND THE SOUTH DAKOTA HUNTER SAFETY AND FIREARMS EDUCATION (HUNTSAFE) PROGRAM, THE SOUTH DAKOTA BOWHUNTER EDUCATION PROGRAM, TRAPPER EDUCATION, AND THE SOUTH DAKOTA HUNTER DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE IS TO FUND THE RECRUITMENT, RETENTION,AND REACTIVATION OF CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF HUNTERS IN SOUTH DAKOTA BY DEVELOPING A SYSTEM OF PROGRAMS THAT PROMOTES THE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ATTITUDES PERTAINING TO BEING A SAFE LEGAL, AND RESPONSIBLE HUNTER. THESE PROGRAMS SUPPORT THE TEACHING OF HUNTER SKILLS AND OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND CULTIVATE AN INFORMED CONSENT OF HUNTING BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC. OBJECTIVES PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CONDUCT TWELVE TRAINING EVENTS FOR HUNTER, ARCHERY, AND TRAPPER EDUCATION INSTRUCTORS, HAVE 5,700 STUDENTS COMPLETE HUNTER, ARCHERY, AND TRAPPER EDUCATION, AND TO TRAIN 350 TRAINERS/MENTORS FOR HUNTER, ARCHERY AND TRAPPER EDUCATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FEDERAL AID FOR FOR PROJECT FW-1.46 TO IMPLEMENT THE NECESSARY STRATEGIES,ACTIONS, AND CHANGES, DEVELOPED WITHIN THE APPLICABLE LEGAL FRAMEWORK, TO GUARANTEE THAT DNER MEETS ALL THE REQUIREMENTS ANDFULFILLS ALL THE DUTIES THAT PERTAIN TO THE WSFR PROGRAM, THUS SAFEGUARDING AND MAINTAINING PUERTO RICO'S ELIGIBILITY FOR FEDERAL AIDUNDER THE PROGRAM.

?THE MISSION OF THE CONNECTICUT WILDLIFE DIVISION IS TO CONSERVE WILDLIFE RESOURCES FOR THE USE AND APPRECIATION OF THE PUBLIC. HAVING HEALTHY WILDLIFE POPULATIONS REQUIRES A DIVERSITY OF HIGH-QUALITY HABITATS DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT THE STATE. TO CONSERVE WILD BIRDS AND MAMMALS, THE DIVISION'S HABITAT PROGRAM CARRIES OUT HABITAT ENHANCEMENT ACTIVITIES IN FORESTS, WETLANDS, SHRUBLANDS, AND GRASSLANDS THROUGHOUT CONNECTICUT.

SINCE 2017, NATURAL HERITAGE NEW MEXICO (NHNM) HAS BEEN DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE NEW MEXICO RIPARIAN HABITAT MAP (NM-RIPMAP) FOR THE NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND FISH (DEPARTMENT). THE MAP HAS BEEN PRODUCED IN PHASES THAT WERE DELIMITED BY MAJOR RIVER BASINS (I.E., CANADIAN/UPPER PECOS, GILA-LOWER RIO GRANDE-SAN JUAN, LOWER PECOS-TULAROSA, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE, UPPER RIO GRANDE) AND WILL PROVIDE FULL COVERAGE ACROSS THE STATE'S RIPARIAN HABITAT. THE PHASES OF THE MAP ARE PROVIDED FOR PUBLIC USE AT A WORKING SCALE OF 1:6,000 AND HAVE A CONSISTENT STATEWIDE LEGEND. THIS HAS BEEN AN ITERATIVE, PROGRESSIVE, BASIN-BY-BASIN PROJECT OVER FIVE YEARS INVOLVING INTENSIVE DATA GATHERING AND PROCESSING, INCLUDING ACQUIRING THE MOST CURRENT AND HIGH-RESOLUTION AERIAL IMAGERY AS A BASE ALONG WITH LIDAR TO PROVIDE THE VERTICAL DIMENSION. THIS HAS BEEN A COMPLEX, COLLABORATIVE PROJECT WITH THE USFS AND CONTRACTORS, ELEMENTS OF THE PROJECT NOW NEED TO BE NORMALIZED ACROSS THE STATE TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY IN CONTENT AND APPLICATION. IN ADDITION, THE DEPARTMENT HAS IDENTIFIED A NEED FOR A USER GUIDE TO FACILITATE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MAPS BY STAKEHOLDERS. THE OUTCOME OF ADDRESSING THESE ISSUES WILL BE A FULLY DOCUMENTED, UPDATED VERSION OF NM-RIPMAP AVAILABLE ON THE WEB.THE CONTRACTOR WILL PRODUCE A DOWNLOADABLE USER GUIDE THAT INTEGRATES AND EXPANDS ON CURRENT NM-RIPMAP WEBPAGE CONTENT TO MATCH THE UPDATED VERSION OF THE MAP. IT WILL INCLUDE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON MAPPING METHODS, THE U.S. NATIONAL VEGETATION CLASSIFICATION (USNVC) SYSTEM, A COMPARISON TO OTHER WETLAND/RIPARIAN CLASSIFICATION AND MAPPING PRODUCTS AVAILABLE FOR NEW MEXICO, AND SUGGESTED AND APPROPRIATE MAP USES AT MULTIPLE SCALES. NHNM WILL PRODUCE REPORTS REGARDING THE STATUS OF SCOPING, DATA GATHERING AND ANALYSIS FOR THE UPLAND HABITAT MAP AND REGARDING NORMALIZATION AND USER GUIDE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE NM-RIPMAP. NM-RIPMAP NORMALIZATION AND USER GUIDE DEVELOPMENT WILL FACILITATE AND ENHANCE THE USE AND UTILITY OF THE MAP FOR THE DEPARTMENT AND OTHER STATE, FEDERAL, COUNTY, AND MUNICIPAL AGENCIES AND PRIVATE SECTOR AND PUBLIC ENTITIES. NORMALIZATION WILL ENSURE THAT MAP RESULTS AND OUTPUT ARE CONSISTENT AND COMPARABLE THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE USER GUIDE WILL MAKE IT EASIER FOR USERS TO UNDERSTAND, NAVIGATE, AND USE THE MAP.WITH THE COMPLETION OF RIPARIAN HABITAT MAP, THE DEPARTMENT SEEKS TO EXTEND MAPPING BEYOND THE RIPARIAN ZONE INTO TERRESTRIAL UPLAND HABITATS. THIS IS IMPORTANT FOR IDENTIFYING WILDLIFE HABITAT LINKAGES BETWEEN RIPARIAN AND UPLAND HABITATS AND EVALUATING OVERALL TERRESTRIAL HABITAT QUALITY AND EXTENT FOR WILDLIFE USE. THERE IS NO COMPREHENSIVE STATEWIDE HABITAT MAP THAT WOULD BE OPERATIONAL AT SITE-LEVEL AND COULD INFORM SOUND CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AND TO PRIORITIZE HABITAT RESTORATION AND ENHANCEMENT PROJECTS.THE SECOND COMPONENT WOULD CONDUCT A PILOT PROJECT FOR BUILDING A STATEWIDE, TERRESTRIAL WILDLIFE HABITAT MAP THAT WILL TEST APPROACHES, SCALE, DETAIL, AND ACCURACY AND PROVIDE GUIDANCE NEEDED BY NHNM PRIOR TO EXPANDING THE MAPPING EFFORT TO A STATEWIDE PRODUCT. THE PILOT PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON TWO REPRESENTATIVE STUDY AREAS THAT WILL COVER A BREADTH OF NEW MEXICO HABITATS: 1) A GREATER SEVILLETA STUDY AREA WITH GRASSLANDS, DESERT SCRUB, AND OPEN CONIFER WOODLANDS ON THE SEVILLETA NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE (NWR) AND SURROUNDING BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT (BLM) AND 2) AN EASTERN JEMEZ MOUNTAINS STUDY AREA WITH MONTANE FOREST AND WOODLANDS WILL INCLUDE PORTIONS OF THE VALLES CALDERA NATIONAL PRESERVE, BANDELIER NATIONAL MONUMENT, AND SURROUNDING USFS LANDS, BUT NOT LOS ALAMOS NATIONAL LABORATORY NOR TRIBAL LANDS. THE PILOT STUDY AREAS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE DEPENDING ON SCOPING DISCUSSIONS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECREATIONAL SHOOTING AND FIREARMS PRACTICE AT THE EXISTING HOLLY SHELTER SHOOTING RANGE IN PENDER COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA.THE HOLLY SHELTER SHOOTING RANGE WILL BE EXPANDED AND IMPROVED SPECIFICALLY BY:CONSTRUCTING TWO PUBLIC SHOTGUN RANGES (5-STAND),CONSTRUCTING A SHOTGUN PATTERNING LANE,CONSTRUCTING VAULT TOILET BUILDING AT THE EXISTING HOLLY SHELTER SHOOTING RANGE.INSTALLING NEW SEATS ON THE RIFLE RANGE THAT PROVIDE ADJUSTABILITY AND INCREASE HANDICAP ACCESS,INSTALLING RIFLE BENCHES ON THE 50-YD RANGE TO INCREASE ITS USAGE BY SHORT RANGE RIFLE SHOOTERS,ADDING FENCING TO SECURE DOWN RANGE AREA ANDADDING BALLISTIC RUBBER BLOCK PROTECTION FOR SELECTED BAFFLE POSTS ON THE 50-YD RANGE.THIS GRANT WILL HELP TO SATISFY THE CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED FUTURE DEMAND FOR PUBLIC SHOOTING FACILITIES IN NORTH CAROLINA. OVER 800,000 CITIZENS LIVE WITHIN A 30-MILE RADIUS OF OUR PROPOSED FACILITY, AND 1.2 MILLION LIVE WITHIN A 50-MILE RADIUS. THE NCWRC HAS SEEN A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN USAGE OF SHOOTING RANGE FACILITIES ACROSS THE STATE, AND THIS GRANT WILL BE SIGNIFICANT IN INCREASING PROGRAMS OFFERED AT THE EXISTING FACILITY. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO BENEFIT NEARBY, LOCAL ECONOMIES AS RECREATIONAL SHOOTERS AND HUNTERS ARE WILLING TO TRAVEL CONSIDERABLE DISTANCES TO USE PUBLIC SHOOTING RANGE FACILITIES. LOCAL ECONOMIES WILL DERIVE BENEFITS FROM INCREASED SALES OF GASOLINE, FOOD, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, AND OTHER EXPENSES ASSOCIATED WITH RECREATIONAL SHOOTING AND FIREARMS PRACTICE.

OFF HIGHWAY VEHICLE TRAIL MANAGEMENT AT NORTH CUMBERLAND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AREA- ED CARTER UNITABSTRACTTWRA HAS IDENTIFIED A SIGNIFICANT NEED TO ESTABLISH AN OFF HIGHWAY VEHICLE (OHV) TRAILS MANAGEMENT PROGRAM THE ED CARTER UNIT OF NORTH CUMBERLAND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AREA (NC WMA). ED CARTER UNIT HAS HAD UNCHECKED OHV USE AND EXPERIENCED WILDLIFE HABITAT DEGRADATION AND HAD DISRUPTIONS TO WILDLIFE MIGRATION AND HUNTING. MANY OF THE TRAILS ARE IN BIOLOGICALLY SENSITIVE AREAS, ARE AGING, AND ARE BEGINNING TO DEGRADE. OTHERS ARE LOCATED IN AREAS NOT SUITED FOR OHV USE. WE EXPECT THAT AN OHV PROGRAM ON THE ED CARTER UNIT OF NC WMA WILL RESULT IN A DECREASE OF UNAUTHORIZED OHV USE AND WILL MINIMIZE NEGATIVE IMPACTS TO WILDLIFE MIGRATIONS, HABITAT, AND HUNTING ON THE AREA. WE EXPECT TO MAKE LEGITIMATE THROUGH TRAILS TO INCREASE ACCESS FOR HUNTERS AND OTHER OUTDOOR RECREATIONISTS WHILE PROTECTING RESOURCE VALUES.

LAND ACQUISITION: THE TENNESSEE WILDLIFE RESOURCES AGENCY (TWRA) WILL ACQUIRE ONE TRACT TOTALING
4150 ACRES. THIS TRACT, REFERRED TO AS THE LONE STAR TRACT, WILL BE PURCHASED FROM LONE STAR INDUSTRIES, INC.
AND CONVEYED IN FEE SIMPLE TO THE STATE OF TENNESSEE. THE TRACT IS LOCATED AT TAX MAP 117, PARCEL 2.00
AND IS LOCATED IN RURAL CUMBERLAND COUNTY, WITHIN THE PLANNED ACQUISITION AREA FOR LUPER MOUNTAIN
WMA. WHILE THE STATE WILL OWN THE WHOLE TRACT, ONLY A PORTION OF THE TRACT WILL BE MANAGED BY TWRA.
THE REMAINDER OF THE TRACT WILL BE MANAGED BY TDEC AS PART OF THE CUMBERLAND TRAIL.

IN STATEWIDE WILDLIFE LAND ACQUISITION W-42-L-32 15.611
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS FOR THE FEE SIMPLE ACQUISITION (AND ANY ASSOCIATED MISCELLANEOUS COSTS) OF LAND TO PROTECT AND ENHANCE BIRD AND MAMMAL HABITAT, SUPPORT ECOSYSTEM SERVICES, AND PROVIDE INCREASED FISH AND WILDLIFE-DEPENDENT RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES STATE-WIDE. THIS GRANT ALSO PROVIDES FOR REVIEW AND ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES FOR EASEMENTS, LEASES, AND LICENSES (E.G., UTILITY RIGHT-OF-WAYS) ON LANDS SUPPORTED IN SOME CAPACITY BY THE WILDLIFE RESTORATION PROGRAM AND OUTLINES THE APPROACH FOR DIVESTITURE OF WSFR-SUPPORTED LANDS IN CERTAIN SITUATIONS. INDIANA STATUTE STATES THAT IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE DFW TO PROVIDE FOR THE PROTECTION, REPRODUCTION, CARE, MANAGEMENT, SURVIVAL, AND REGULATION OF WILD ANIMAL POPULATIONS. IT IS THE INTENTION OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT TO PROVIDE THE LAND RESOURCES NECESSARY TO FULFILL THIS RESPONSIBILITY IN ORDER FOR DFW TO SERVE THE BEST INTEREST OF THE RESOURCES AND PEOPLE OF INDIANA (INDIANA CODE TITLE 14, ARTICLE 22, CHAPTER 2, SECTION 3).

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE INCENTIVE PAYMENTS TO COMMUNITIES TO IMPLEMENT DEER MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS THAT UTILIZE REGULATED DEER HUNTING. THIS PROJECT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL HUNTING OPPORTUNITIES FOR DEER HUNTERS ACROSS THE STATE WHO CAN BOTH GAIN ACCESS FOR HUNTING WHILE HELPING MITIGATE THE IMPACTS AND CONFLICTS CAUSED BY OVERABUNDANT DEER POPULATIONS.
